nodes.bodyText: String values are compared using ==, not equals()

It is to skip checking when both is null.
The actual equal checking it after that.
https://github.com/yahoo/athenz/blob/70d39b4244ae41d5d8ba1d7173be8e3093be7a56/libs/java/auth_core/src/main/java/com/yahoo/athenz/auth/oauth/validator/DefaultOAuthJwtAccessTokenValidator.java#L88-L94
I'd suggesting adding a comment explaining that otherwise it does look suspicious
added in 9f86ef6
this is quite an old version of athenz. let's use the latest release.

nodes.bodyText: where/how are we using this example.com/client_id? do we need a such value as default or is the caller expected to always specify a value?

Auth0 has restriction on custom field format, so we need the "https://myapp.example.com/" part as the namespace.
https://auth0.com/docs/api-auth/tutorials/adoption/scope-custom-claims#custom-claims
Also, as we enforced the client ID and cnf checking in the new authority class, the claim name should be specified. For the default value, I just use the value can be found in auth0's docs.

I would suggest if we have a AthenzUtils.getPrincipal method then that method should already return values in lowercase since that's what Athenz uses everywhere. Then we don't have to remember to call toLowerCase() everywhere.

Thank you for suggesting.
I updated both util methods in 646436c & f8cb9ad.
we should keep the number of dependencies in auth_core minimal so not sure why we're using this but it doesn't look right.

nodes.bodyText: seems inconsistent that we lowercase service but not domain?

Thank you for pointing out. CertificateIdentityParser should handle the lowercase. toLowerCase() is not needed here.
Fixed in 2869870 and also removed other unnecessary toLowerCase().
we have :role. defined in AuthortyConsts so we should use that here

Updated in 2c5c855, and try to refactor other hard-coded :role. too.
hard-coded :role. values are preserved in these files, as their context seem to be different.
./servers/zms/src/main/java/com/yahoo/athenz/zms/ZMSResources.java
./servers/zts/src/main/java/com/yahoo/athenz/zts/AccessTokenRequest.java
./servers/zts/src/main/java/com/yahoo/athenz/zts/store/DataStore.java
*Test.java

why did we create this class? we already have the SigningKeyResolver without relying on auth0 implementation and it supports both rsa and ec keys. So rather than creating yet another and adding dependency on auth0 library, take a look at the current key resolver and if necessary extend that class.

As the auth0 class has built-in refresh logic on the JWKS URL, I included the library. However, its behavior is difficult to trace in operation so I updated to depend on the existing JwtsSigningKeyResolver in 591d10e.
I also made some changes on the JwtsSigningKeyResolver class to support file URL.
In addition, as the 2 classes behave differently, I just use weak dependency. Please let me know if extending the class is better.
we should probably log these errors otherwise it's very difficult to debug any issues.
added in 24f0203
lets include a log error entry for this as well.
added in 24f0203
seems to be inefficient to handle just a single string. we can just create a set and add the entry without creating additional objects.
Thank you for pointing out. fixed: 1e7303e
I think I made a comment earlier about this. it looks like this method already does the to lowercase conversion thus the caller doesn't need to call it again.
agreed. related reply: #943 (comment), #943 (comment)
